intro: Sideroxylon eucoriaceum, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its aromatic wood, it has been historically valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of timber.
